1.text: A mild answer breaketh wrath: but a harsh word stirreth up fury.

2.text: The tongue of the wise adorneth knowledge: but the mouth of fools bubbleth out folly.

3.text: The eyes of the Lord in every place behold the good and the evil.

4.text: A peaceable tongue is a tree of life: but that which is immoderate, shall crush the spirit.

5.text: A fool laugheth at the instruction of his father: but he that regardeth reproofs shall become prudent. In abundant justice there is the greatest strength: but the devices of the wicked shall be rooted out.

6.text: The house of the just is very much strength: and in the fruits of the wicked is trouble.

7.text: The lips of the wise shall disperse knowledge: the heart of fools shall be unlike.

8.text: The victims of the wicked are abominable to the Lord: the vows of the just are acceptable.

9.text: The way of the wicked is an abomination to the Lord: he that followeth justice is beloved by him.

10.text: Instruction is grievous to him that forsaketh the way of life: he that hateth reproof shall die.

11.text: Hell and destruction are before the Lord: how much more the hearts of the children of men?

12.text: A corrupt man loveth not one that reproveth him: nor will he go to the wise.

13.text: A glad heart maketh a cheerful countenance: but by grief of mind the spirit is cast down.

14.text: The heart of the wise seeketh instruction: and the mouth of fools feedeth on foolishness.

15.text: All the days of the poor are evil: a secure mind is like a continual feast.

16.text: Better is a little with the fear of the Lord, than great treasures without content,

17.text: It is better to be invited to herbs with love, than to a fatted calf with hatred.

18.text: A passionate man stirreth up strifes: he that is patient appeaseth those that are stirred up.

19.text: The way of the slothful is as a hedge of thorns; the way of the just is without offence.

20.text: A wise son maketh a father joyful: but the foolish man despiseth his mother.

21.text: Folly is joy to the fool: and the wise man maketh straight his steps.

22.text: Designs are brought to nothing where there is no counsel: but where there are many counsellors, they are established.

23.text: A man rejoiceth in the sentence of his mouth: and a word in due time is best.

24.text: The path of life is above for the wise, that he may decline from the lowest hell.

25.text: The Lord will destroy the house of the proud: and will strengthen the borders of the widow.

26.text: Evil thoughts are an abomination to the Lord: and pure words most beautiful shall be confirmed by him.

27.text: He that is greedy of gain troubleth his own house: but he that hateth bribes shall live. By mercy and faith sins are purged away: and by the fear of the Lord every one declineth from evil.

28.text: The mind of the just studieth obedience: the mouth of the wicked over floweth with evils.

29.text: The Lord is far from the wicked: and he will hear the prayers of the just.

30.text: The light of the eyes rejoiceth the soul: a good name maketh the bones fat.

31.text: The ear that heareth the reproofs of life, shall abide in the midst of the wise.

32.text: He that rejecteth instruction, despiseth his own soul: but he that yieldeth to reproof possesseth understanding.

33.text: The fear of the Lord is the lesson of wisdom: and humility goeth before glory.
